articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: When war last came to the edges of Lebanon's capital nearly two decades ago, Bilal Sahlab drove his family to a secluded mountain town, rented an apartment and waited out the bombing.
articles.title: As war drums beat, those in Beirut suburb have nowhere to flee

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk, Patricia Zengerle, Steve Holland
articles.description: The Biden administration has decided to lift a ban on U.S. sales of offensive weapons to Saudi Arabia, three sources familiar with the matter told Reuters on Friday, reversing a three-year-old policy to pressure the Kingdom to wind down the Yemen war.
articles.title: Exclusive: US to lift ban on offensive weapons sales to Saudi Arabia, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israeli airstrike on a car deep inside Lebanon killed a senior figure from Palestinian armed group Hamas on Friday evening, a Hamas source and two other security sources told Reuters.
articles.title: Israeli strike kills senior Hamas figure in south Lebanon

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian missile strike hit a supermarket in the Ukrainian town of Kostiantynivka in the front-line Donetsk region on Friday, killing at least ten people and injuring 35 others, Ukrainian officials said.
articles.title: Ten killed, 35 hurt in Russian strike on supermarket in Ukraine's east

articles.author: Michael Kahn
articles.description: The problem is acute for nations that spent four decades under Soviet domination and have long warned about the threat from a more assertive Russia.
articles.title: Eastern Europe's armies struggle to enlist young people with war not far away

articles.author: Nathan Layne, Joseph Ax
articles.description: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump said he will hold a news conference on Thursday afternoon at his residence in Palm Beach, Florida, his first public appearance since his Democratic opponent, Kamala Harris, selected Minnesota Governor Tim Walz as her running mate.
articles.title: Trump to hold news conference while Harris visits Michigan auto workers

articles.author: Anthony Deutsch, Tom Balmforth, Jonathan Landay
articles.description: Dozens of Russian military personnel are being trained in Iran to use the Fath-360 close-range ballistic missile system, two European intelligence sources told Reuters, adding that they expected the imminent delivery of hundreds of the satellite-guided weapons to Russia for its war in Ukraine.
articles.title: Exclusive: Iran to deliver hundreds of ballistic missiles to Russia soon, intel sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Microsoft researchers said on Friday that Iran government-tied hackers tried breaking into the account of a "high ranking official" on the U.S. presidential campaign in June, weeks after breaching the account of a county-level U.S. official.
articles.title: Microsoft researchers report Iran hackers targeting US officials before election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hundreds of people protested in the Bangladeshi capital Dhaka on Friday against violence targeting the country's minority Hindus since former prime minister Sheikh Hasina quit and fled the country earlier this week.
articles.title: Hundreds protest in Dhaka over violence against Hindus in Bangladesh

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Panama's President Jose Raul Mulino told broadcaster CNN on Friday he would give Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro safe passage to act as a "bridge" to a third country in order to allow for a political transition in Venezuela.
articles.title: Panama offers safe passage to Venezuela's Maduro to allow for transition
